_prev_prog_2.CH_OtherChanges: Hazard review in 2023 accounted for addition of 3rd aqua ammonia tank.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Check for leaks in in tanks, valves, hoses, available PPE/condition, plumbing to scrubber tank, eye wash/shower operation, site gauges/valve. Check containment for cracks/failures.

The distance to the toxic endpoint for the worst-case release scenario is at 0.23 miles downwind; for the alternative release scenario, the distance to the toxic endpoint is 0.10 miles downwind from the point of release.

Regulated Pesticide Worst-Case and Alternative Release Scenarios. 
The worst-case release scenario is based on a warehouse fire causing the total release of the regulated pesticides, using an F stability class and a wind speed of 3.4 miles per hour. The alternative release scenario (or a more plausible potential incident) is a spill of a container of each individual regulated pesticide substance using adjusted modeling parameters, D stability class and a wind speed of 6.7 miles per hour. 

The toxic endpoints for both the Worst-case Release Scenario and the Alternative Release Scenario are orders of magnitude less than the regulated toxic endpoint. The distance to the property line is further than the distance to the highest downwind concentration.

ES  4.0 FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no accidental releases of aqua ammonia during the last five years resulting in death, injuries, evacuation(s), a shelter in-place order, or property or environmental damage. 
.
ES  5.0 THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 
The Emergency Response Plan was most recently will be implemented in the event of a release of a regulated substance. The Facilitys emergency response program has been developed in accordance with the following regulations:
- OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38.
- US EPA 40 CFR Subpart E Emergency Response; and
- Section 25503, Division 6.95 of the California Health and Safety Code, Hazardous Materials Business Plan.
.
ES  6.0 PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY 
Safety improvement is an on-going process at the Facility. Periodic evaluations will be performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Specific changes to the aqua ammonia system at the Facility will be implemented as needed. 
.
ES  7.0 THE WORST-CASE RELEASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS
Aqua Ammonia Worst-case and Alternative Release Scenarios. 
The worst-case release scenario is the failure of the storage tank when filled to the greatest amount, which would release 77,000 pounds of aqua ammonia (10,000 gallons, equivalent to 47,700 lbs of NH3) in a Pasquill stability class F atmosphere. The alternative release scenario, based on the hazard review (or a more plausible potential incident), is a 1,299-gallon (10,000 lbs) release from a broken pipe with an increased wind speed and D stability modelling parameter

esses. Results indicate that no high-risk hazards were identified through the hazard review update. 

Operating Procedures: 
Written standard operating procedures have been developed for the covered processes and are reviewed and revised as needed.

Training: 
The BRSI staff, as well as the Butte County Rice Growers Association (BUCRA) corporate staff, understands that incidents involving the accidental release of regulated substances can be reduced by having trained operations and maintenance staff. The current training program is comprised of the following:
- Providing initial employee training.
- Requiring periodic refresher training.
- Updating and training employees because of a new equipment addition or modifications.
- Using competency testing, involving written tests and observation following training, to ensure understanding; and
- Maintaining training records for each employee.

Maintenance: 
The maintenance program at the Facility is intended to preserve the mechanical integrity of the process equipment to minimize the potential for an accidental release. The maintenance program includes equipment inspection, preventive maintenance, recordkeeping, and training. 

Compliance Audits: 
Periodic compliance audits to assess the effectiveness of the written plan must be conducted every three years. Records of the audits and follow-up documentation are maintained to indicate findings and resolution of findings. 

Incident Investigation: 
An incident investigation program is in place at the Facility and incident investigation procedures would be implemented, if needed.

Other Code Applicability: 
The Facility implements the provisions of the following guidelines, regulations, and standards for these regulated substances (partial list):

Regulated Substances
- United States Department of Labor, Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.38, Employee emergency response plan and fire prevention plans.
- United States Environmental Protection A

ES  1.0 FACILITY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE POLICY
The owners, management, and employees of the Bear River Supply, Inc., Rio Oso Facility (herein referred to as BRSI or the Facility) at 218 Pleasant Grove Road, Rio Oso, California 95674 are committed to the prevention of an accidental release of aqua ammonia or regulated pesticides. If an accidental release should occur, the Facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment. A detailed Emergency Response/Contingency Plan has been developed and will be implemented in the event of an accidental release.
.
ES  2.0 FACILITY INFORMATION
The Facility is a retail agricultural facility whose primary activity is the sale of fertilizers and pre-packaged agricultural chemicals to farmers in the Sacramento Valley of Northern California. Applicable NAICS codes for this facility include 42491 (Farm Supplies Merchant Wholesalers). 
- Aqua ammonia is received by truck, stored in three, 10,000-gallon aboveground storage tanks.
- Aqua ammonia is loaded out into DOT tanker trucks for direct application as a crop production nutrient.
- The maximum quantity of aqua ammonia (20.66%) stored at the site is 231,000 pounds.
- Three regulated pesticides are received by truck, handled by forklift, stored in the warehouse, and distributed for direct application in pest control. The maximum quantity of regulated pesticides stored at the Facility is 16,153 pounds.
.
ES  3.0 ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
The Facility has implemented the following prevention program elements for the management of the aqua ammonia and the regulated pesticides.

Safety Information: 
BRSI ensures that information concerning covered processes and regulated substances are up-to-date and available for review by employees.

Hazard Review: 
A hazard review of the regulated processes is conducted every five years or as needed by changes in the proc
